meanings.definition: A symbol, word, or phrase legally registered or established by use as representing a company or product.
meanings.sent1: The company's trademark, a red apple, was easily recognizable.
meanings.sent2: The trademark on the box indicated the product's origin.
meanings.sent3: The trademark of the smiling sun on the logo always brightened people's day.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter became the trademark of joy in the office.
meanings.sent5: The trademark of the roaring lion symbolized strength and power.

meanings.definition: To label (a product) with a trademark.
meanings.sent1: They decided to trademark their new invention to protect it from being copied.
meanings.sent2: The company will trademark their latest creation before releasing it to the market.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would trademark his mom's famous meatloaf recipe.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to trademark her unique dance move to make it her own.
meanings.sent5: The artist planned to trademark their signature painting technique for recognition.

meanings.definition: To register a trademark for (a product or company).
meanings.sent1: The company needed to trademark their logo to establish ownership.
meanings.sent2: They decided to trademark their brand name to prevent imitations.
meanings.sent3: He thought it would be funny to trademark his cat's meow as a sound effect.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to trademark her catchphrase to make it official.
meanings.sent5: The business owner rushed to trademark their slogan before anyone else could claim it.
